title: Makes technical corrections to provisions on possession and transportation of wildlife
summary: Makes technical corrections to provisions on possession and transportation of wildlife.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                          295

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced by M. of A. HEVESI -- read once and referred to the Committee
         on Environmental Conservation

       AN  ACT  to  amend  the  environmental  conservation law, in relation to
         making technical corrections to provisions on wildlife

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Section 11-0511 of the environmental conservation law, as
    2  amended by chapter 692 of the laws  of  2004,  is  amended  to  read  as
    3  follows:
    4  S 11-0511. Possession and transportation of wildlife.
    5    Subject  to  the  provisions  of  section  11-0512 of this article, no
    6  person shall, except under a license or permit first obtained  from  the
    7  department containing the prominent warning notice specified in subdivi-
    8  sion  nine  of  section  11-0917  of this article, possess, transport or
    9  cause to be transported, imported or exported any  live  wolf,  wolfdog,
   10  coyote,  coydog,  fox,  skunk,  RACOON,  venomous  reptile [or raccoon],
   11  endangered species designated pursuant to section 11-0535 of this title,
   12  species named in section 11-0536 of  this  title  or  other  species  of
   13  native  or  non-native  live wildlife or fish where the department finds
   14  that possession, transportation,  importation  or  exportation  of  such
   15  species  of  wildlife  or  fish  would present a danger to the health or
   16  welfare of the people of the state, an individual resident or indigenous
   17  fish or wildlife population. Environmental conservation officers, forest
   18  rangers and members of the state police  may  seize  every  such  animal
   19  possessed  without  such  license or permit. No action for damages shall
   20  lie for such seizure, and disposition of seized animals shall be at  the
   21  discretion of the department.
   22    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD01560-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the environmental conservation law, in relation to making technical corrections to provisions on wildlife
